snippet: Ro Khanna, a Democrat who served in the Commerce Department, is considering a run against Representative Michael M. Honda.
abstract: Indian-American lawyer Ro Khanna is considering a primary challenge against Japanese-American Michael M Honda in California's 17th Congressional District, first in United States to have a majority of Asian-Americans; challenge has already set off intense maneuvering in district, and highlights potential emerging rivalries among different Asian groups.

headline.main: Rivalries Begin to Emerge in a New Seat of Power
headline.print_headline: Rivalries Begin to Emerge In a New Seat of Power

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Tuesday, selections include the first revenue increase for the music industry in this century, a call for more American defenders as awa...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Tuesday, selections include the first revenue increase for the music industry in this century, a call for more American defenders as awareness grows of cyberattacks from other countries and what some Yahoo employees are saying about the end of telecommuting.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: A Tough iWatch and Pynchon's Alley

snippet: Apple has agreed to reimburse parents whose children purchased virtual goods in mobile apps without the parents’ knowledge.
abstract: Apple has agreed to reimburse parents whose children purchased virtual goods in mobile apps without the parents’ knowledge.

headline.main: Apple Agrees to Settle Lawsuit Over App Purchases by Children

snippet: Keith Meister, a protégé of Carl C. Icahn, and Jeff T. Blau, chief of The Related Companies, disclosed a 9.8 percent ownership stake in CommonWealth REIT on Tuesday.
abstract: Keith Meister, a protégé of Carl C. Icahn, and Jeff T. Blau, chief of The Related Companies, disclosed a 9.8 percent ownership stake in CommonWealth REIT on Tuesday.

snippet: While the increase was tiny and the total revenue, $16.5 billion, a far cry from the $38 billion at its peak, the news is a psychological boost to an industry long in decline.
abstract: International Federation of the Phonographic Industry reports that the music industry saw an increase in global sales of 0.3 percent, with total revenue of $16.5 billion, raising hopes of a start of a long-sought recovery; rise in sales is the first time for an increase since 1999.

headline.main: Music Industry Sales Rise, and Digital Revenue Gets the Credit
headline.print_headline: Music Industry Sales Rise, and Digital Revenue Gets the Credit
